headline: Chicken Marsala
description: Chicken Marsala is an Italian-style recipe for tender pan-fried chicken breasts with a sweet Marsala wine and mushroom sauce. It's super quick and easy to make for a weeknight dinner AND sophisticated enough for company.

video.description: Chicken Marsala is an Italian-style recipe for tender pan-fried chicken breasts in a sweet Marsala wine and mushroom sauce. It's super quick and easy to make for a weeknight dinner AND sophisticated enough for company.
video.name: How to Make Italian Chicken Marsala

name: Chicken Marsala
recipeIngredient: 4 medium skinless, boneless chicken breast halves - pounded 1/4 inch thick

recipeInstructions.text: In a shallow dish or bowl, mix together the flour, salt, pepper and oregano.
Coat chicken pieces in flour mixture.
In a large skillet, melt butter in oil over medium heat. Place chicken in the pan, and lightly brown.
Turn over chicken pieces, and add mushrooms. Pour in wine and sherry.
Cover skillet; simmer chicken 10 minutes, turning once, until no longer pink and juices run clear.

review.reviewBody: I used olive oil instead of butter, and it tasted fine. Next time I make this dish, and there will definitely be a next time, I'll increase te mushrooms to one and a half to two cups.

This is really a good start but I added basil, garlic and parsley since we like a little more spice. I did put the flour mixture in a bag to coat the chicken as some others mentioned and that was easy. I served linguine with it and it was a hit.

This is fabulous as-is! I served it with mashed potatoes and I added just a touch of heavy cream at the end, but otherwise followed directions exactly and am very pleased. THANK YOU for another great family dinner that's good enough for company too.
Easy, great flavor, I used 8 chicken tenders and 1/2 cup more mushrooms
So simple and tasty, added garlic and a slight amount of cornstarch mixed with chicken broth for a little thickening of gravy
Must try! Easy to cook and surely everybody will love it.

Gosh, this was good, and I don't get the fuss about the amount of time or the messy kitchen. It couldn't have been easier! I had chicken filets sliced thin and my mushrooms were sliced, so that was easy, I did put a little bread crumbs in with the flour, and I did add a tad of cornstarch dissolved in 1/4 C of water, and I did add just a dash of half and half to make it creamy. Next time I might use a little more wine because those two things probably cut into the taste of the wine. This is a keeper recipe, and easy easy.
This is one of my go-to dishes for a quick and easy dinner that looks great and tastes great.
I have been making this recipe for years, takes about an hour from start to finish, cheap easy marsala recipe
No changes. Tasted great!
Very good - will make again!

Good basic recipe...I doubled the recipe and added beef broth, garlic and shallots. Also added much more salt and pepper. Topped it off with parmesan and a squeeze of lemon (personal preference). We are allergic to chicken so we used pork tenderloin, pounded very thin, dipped in flour and plant-based egg substitute. Makes a nice crust.
Did not have sherry so just sweet marsala, used dark meat 'cause I'm that kind. Served on mashed potatoes with fava beans side dish. Really hit the spot! Sad, no photo, it is all gone, next time.

I wanted so much for this recipe to work, as I love the chicken marsala from my restaurant, but it just didn't. I was not rushed for time, and that's a good thing, because this recipe will consume 2-3 hours of your afternoon. The mess it creates in the kitchen, I don't even want to think about. In the end, you get chicken cutlets that taste like they were marinated in wine. I'll continue to shell out the $50 for a chicken marsala dinner for two at my favorite restaurant.
Loved it! Just made another giant batch. It is now a favorite!

So, I was looking for a good recipe for Chicken Marsala and as my go to site I came to AllRecipes for just that. Before I cook anything as I’m sure some of you do as well, I like to read the reviews to see what the end results are for any tips. I found that a few people used cornstarch to thicken the sauce and also used seasoned bread crumbs in the flour to coat the chicken which I found both recommendations to work out amazingly well!! I added extra Marsala to strengthen the flavor and doubled all the other sauce ingredients so I had some leftover. With all that being said, this recipe is now my new go to!!🤤🤤 I’ve only ever had Chicken Marsala 1 other time and it was at this restaurant me and my girlfriend went to. I was not to impressed with the meal which completely turned me off of even wanting to try it again. However, I was in Walmart doing some food shopping the other day getting some cooking wines and decided maybe I should try cooking the dish myself. Well, turns out I actually like it!! Hope y’all found my post helpful.😁 Have a blessed day!
Quick and easy. I added a little flour and milk at the end to thicken the sauce.
Super easy and extremely tasty. Served it over some leftover mashed potatoes. One pan to clean.
It was so easy and sooo delicious! This will definitely be on our menu from now on.

This was delicious! The only change I made was using garlic salt in place of regular salt, and I added a little cornstarch at the end to thicken the sauce. My husband raved about it and said please make it again. Next time, I want to try it with portobella mushrooms and I'm going to try reducing the oil and butter just a little. Served with mashed potatoes.
Oh, no! Not cooking sherry! No 'cooking wine' is worth having! Use a good Dry Sack sherry.
l added more mushrooms, more butter, more canned milk, more chicken broth. Simmered till thickened, serve over garlic mashed potatoes. YUMMMMMMMM
Easy and delicious. My friends loved it!

Very good. Added 1/4 c heavy cream to the sauce. Didn't have Marsala, used Sherry. Only used one chicken beast so cut down on everything else. Fed two. Served with jasmine rice cooked in chicken broth with one-half teaspoon of Better than Boullion and a couple shakes of Everything Bagel Spice.

My husband loved it!! Even took a pic of his plate. The chicken was moist and had enough sauce for the two of us. If you were having it over pasta or more than 2 people double the sauce. After reading numerous reviews I added Italian seasoning to the flour mixture and fresh garlic to the pan before adding the chicken back in. I also used a lot more mushrooms! I had to sub chicken broth for marsala and dry vermouth for sherry. I'm sure marsala makes it much tastier. I did watch some of the video which helped since I missed some things reading the recipe. Such as pounding chicken and taking the chicken out of pan before adding mushrooms and the liquid. This is a keeper!
I think I would have added some garlic for some flavor and some capers. Leo Choron

I’ve tried several recipes and this is the only one that came out correct! Loved it! And everyone ate it. I need to figure out how to make more sauce though. I also used way more breasts to feed everyone ( probably why I needed more sauce).

Great directions (thank you) and yes delicious. Super easy. Mine came out as good as any I have had in a restaurant. I used boneless chicken thighs, pounded a few times. Also used sherry in addition to masala, from a liquor store. Served over freshly made pasta from a local store. My guest was impressed. Dog loved the leftovers. 😳
Absolutely delicious and easy to make.

The flavor was robust. I added a splash of cream, and I also would consider adding a splash of chicken stock next time to the sauce. not sure I'd I cooked it at too high a temptation but their wasn't much sauce to add to noodles and chicken after cooking. Would make again.

We are in a no salt household. Added double the herbs, garlic powder and onion powder. Will add some hot Hungarian Paprika the next time to spice it up a little bit. Boy is it hard cooking without salt!
A little bland. Maybe some chicken broth and some heavy cream would have made a good, creamy sauce. Next time I make this I will add garlic powder to the flour mixture.

All ingredients were readily available locally. I had never made anything with wine in the recipe. We were a little skeptical, but since I knew the actual alcohol would cook off adding the flavor, tried it. Very easy to make, chicken remained moist and very tender. We enjoyed a great dinner with vegetables as sides.
This recipe is super easy and delicious. It whips up in no time at all. I serve with seasoned rice or mashed potatoes along with a nice vegetable. Enjoy.
I left out garlic and added more mushrooms but stuck to recipe and we loved it. The chicken was tender, moist and the sauce delicious.
This is fool proof LOVE this! Family Favorite.

I made the recipe exactly as stated except for the following: I didn't have Marsala wine so used Merlot and I added about a quarter of a cup of cream at the end. Those who said that the chicken was tough must have cooked it too long and/or not pounded it first. I served it with asparagus and Angel Hair pasta and my family absolutely loved it! Will definitely make this again. (Edited to add that I doubled the recipe for our family of 7)
I cut the amount of butter and oil in half. Next time I make it I'm doubling or tripling the mushrooms and sauce and serving it over pasta.

Made it, loved it, must admit I did my own modifications (thighs instead of tenders, less butter and oil) and it was still great. In fact, I'm on this site because I looked it up to make it again RIGHT NOW. lol

Delicious! To give the flour extra flavor I also loaded it up with Italian Seasoning, garlic powder, and extra salt and pepper. Next, I added generous fresh garlic and mozzarella to the chicken during the last few minutes. This is a great simple recipe for a tasty restaurant-style meal at home. Allrecipes is my go-to for easy to make meals!
Yummy, fast and easy. Perfect for a working mom. 🙂👍

I follow this chicken marsala recipe almost exactly and it's a household favorite! The only change I make is to sautee the mushrooms separately, in butter and marsala wine, and add to the chicken afterwards. This gives the mushrooms a nice char and a bit of bite - perfect!
DELICIOUS!!!

Not sure how they came up with this recipe, but it's incorrect in many many ways. There are many many many better recipes available online, this made as is (I tried it last night) was a greasy, disgusting mess. 1. Way too much fat. Twice as much as needed, and needs to be drained, see 2. 2. Do NOT leave the fat in the pan, drain it off. 3. Deglaze the pan with with alcohol (way too much, see 4). 4. Using alcohol as the only liquid is a huge mistake. Don't use sherry in Marsala, use Marsala, but add chicken stock, and a bit of half and half at the end. 5. Add some herbs, thyme?

I add 1/4 of a Walla Walla sweet onion, just because I had it. Served with Jasmine rice and fresh asparagus. My wife was drooling as the aroma wafted into the living room. The dinner definitely passed inspection.

I was impressed with the video and followed as per the recipe. The sauce was liquid and greasy, and the chicken was chewy and tasteless, even tho my IR thermometer registered at 190°. I made enough for two meals, and my DOH told me not to serve it again. I will dump the sauce and repurpose the chicken. Too much butter and oil. Would have been better using chicken broth instead of oil.
Loved it. I added extra Italian seasonings in flour and on chicken then follow another reviewer oven instructions which made this dish PERFECT. Thanks for a family favorite dish.
did n't make any changes.
Forgot the garlic! Otherwise, I love your simple presentation.

The only change I made is one which any halfway decent cook SHOULD make: I categorically refused to use cooking sherry! NEVER use a wine you wouldn’t drink! I substituted a nice dry sherry, but of course needed to add additional salt to taste. Turned out very well minus the barbaric cooking wine directive!
This is an all time family favorite. I didn't have to adjust anything from this recipe. This is as good if not better than Olive Garden's.
The recipe was perfect and as easy as instructed. I added a cup of chicken broth because my husband always complains about not having enough sauce. Thank you very simple and quick.
We love this easy recipe
This was amazing, the directions were excellent! since it was my first time making it and it turned out just as good as I have had in restaurants I am completely satisfied! thank you
Excellent! I added 1/4 cup half & half at end for a creamier sauce.
I loved this, Just doubled the sauce! Served over angel hair pasta. yummy
It was easy, and gun to make.
Super easy and over the top YUM!
Family loved it! Even my ridiculously picky 7 yr old liked it!! I needed to cook the chicken 15 minutes longer than what it says though but my chicken halves were somewhat thick.
it was pretty good. very tender chicken. could have used more marsala flavor. i doubled the mushrooms. should have doubled the wines as well.
Dish was easy to make and tasted quite good. Next time I'd probably throw in another 1/2C of mushrooms, but the dish was quite delectable as it was. Thanks for the help!
So delicious, I need to get me some fresh herbs to make this even better. 😋

This was DELICIOUS! I haven't had a good chicken marsala in years, so my mouth was watering throughout the entire prep and cooking process. I was not disappointed! This is definitely a ☆☆☆☆☆ recipe that I'll be making again and again.
I loved it!
Very good. I've made Chicken Masala for years & this recipe reminded me how great it really is. And Chicken Piccata is my all time favorite over Marsala.

We like thin sliced Brest so I don’t cook it quite as long but this is an easy recipe that is absolutely delicious. I haven’t cooked for close to 20 years and I was very capable of this recipe. My 90 years old dad love it.
Easy fast delicious great with egg noodles or potatoes

Wonderful! As always, I made it exactly to the recipe. It was so good! Very flavorful. Although, next time I will add a small amount of fresh garlic. Served it with angel hair pasta, a heavier pasta would be fine if you're going to "gravy" it up a bit, but I preferred it just as it was. I believe it may be the next Christmas dinner!!
This recipe is quick and easy to make. I added sliced onions and halved plum tomatoes. Served over a bed of white rice. Delicious.

I have used this recipe many times. I do have a few tweaks as follows: - add a tsp of knorr chicken stock to the flour mixture and a little more oregano and some rosemary and thyme - add half onion and a clove of garlic

Not my favorite. But first time and I still had to tweak it. Add garlic. Obviously. Also you'll need to keep some flour of to the side to thicken up the sauce. I would dice an onion in next time and possibly saute lightly prior to adding. So they have a crisp char. Fun base to start with but it lacks depth. A lot.
Great

My favorite chicken marsala recipe yet. I like to add more mushrooms. I have been making it for the last 4-5 years and it is ALWAYS a hit! Making it for a dinner party today and everyone is so excited.
I normally really enjoy recipes I find here but this one…… I couldn’t eat it. It was disgusting
It came out great even my company loved it, I would definitely make again. I used thick chicken breasts sliced in half and real marsala wine, 2x the amount of mushrooms.
Super delicious and simple to make. This dish was super yum. A few ingredients and a whole lot of favor. The wine and Sherry made a wonderful glaze.
so easy and delicious!
Love this recipe. I usually double or triple the mushrooms. Also sometimes add 1/2 c or so of heavy whipping cream.
I made this exactly how it was written, and it was delicious!

I've made this recipe many times. It is a go to for company dinners and dinners to take to someone. My family has loved it for years. The kids are on their own now, but whenever they come visit they request that I make this. I make it exactly as written except I eyeball the wine. I may have a heavy hand with the wine! I also let it simmer longer than 10 minutes.
It was delicious and pretty fast!
Absolutely delicious! I added fresh Parsley at the end & only used Marsala.
I’ve used this recipe repeatedly. Love it! I add chopped shallots and garlic. I also add a little thickener as I like a thicker sauce.
Super easy and delicious!

Very good recipe. I added Basil to the oil when browning. I didn't cook the chicken all the way and returned the chicken to the pan to simmer with sauce. 
I didn't have fresh mushrooms so I used canned. Bummer yes, but not as bad as I thought. It was good. Will make again.
Easy and delicious! I substituted white wine for marsala & sherry. This will become a normal dish in my "everyday" rotation.

I've learned not to change a recipe the first go around in order to experience the original taste. With this recipe, I felt no changes, additions or deletions were necessary. My Mom and I loved it. And I will certainly prepare this dish many more times. Thank you.
I had to add a little more salt and next time I’m going to thicken the sauce up with a cornstarch slurry.
Delicious. Used fresh oregano, caramelized the mushrooms after taking the browned chicken out of the pan then added the liquid and returned the chicken to the pan to simmer.

Excellent. Only changes were more muhsrooms (we love them) and, as others suggested, nearly doubled the marsala (skipped cooking sherry altogether) for additional sauce. Next time, may either slice or cube chicken, perhaps add thinly sliced onions, for another take. Will be making again next week for dinner guests.
Easy to follow instructions. The marsala was not cooked down all the way, adding a thinking agent may help with the dish.

We liked it. I was able to use up some marsala wine which was a bonus because we use it only for cooking. I dont normally cook with marsala. Left overs were very good. excellent cold on a salad. i dont use heavy cream so i subbed in some half and half thickening with a tsp of corn starch. it was plenty creamy and thick. I'm sure whole milk would also be perfectly fine with additional corn starch. just remember to combine the starch and milk before you add to the pan.. whip it real good.
Delicious!
Delicious and easy
Great dish! Followed the recipe exactly and the flavor was delicious. Nice recipe.

Wife loved it.
I suggest doubling the wine to have more "sauce" - and using an entire cup of mushrooms, 1/4 cup was 25% of what we'd like :)
Overall a great quickie recipe..
Was awesome
Loved it!
The flavor was just ok and the steps are wrong. The chicken is soggy. The mushrooms should be cooked separately. Same pan but not with the chicken.
